fields.description:
Following the move to using {{<common:/>}}, regressions involving ${utils} have arisen.

{{globalScriptAndStyleIncludes.jspf}} included a declaration to {{useBean}}

{quote}{{<jsp:useBean id="utils" class="com.cenqua.fisheye.web.JspUtils"/>}}{quote}
This enabled the use of ${utils} on pages including the JSPF, and its removal has opened the way for the regression.

I've fixed an instance in the login page where the product name wasn't shown and a logged in state for the tabs persisted, but there are others - some 65 uses of ${utils.
[Review: CR-FE-4564|https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-4564]

Can you take a look and massage where required please?
fields.summary: ${utils} not trustable after move away from JSPF use
Spinner never goes away for anon users

fields.description:
I'm submitting this suggestion, following an e-mail from Douglas Butler. I asked if, when creating a defect through Crucible, instead of asking for Ranking and Classification, we could configure which fields of the Defect issue type are asked for. Douglas explained that defect ranking and classification are a Crucible parameter and are not stored in or pulled from JIRA.

That's my suggestion. Crucible should allow the creation of JIRA defects, with JIRA's own issue fields. At our company we already use JIRA and it's not useful to track review issues on Crucible instead.
fields.summary: Crucible creates JIRA defects

fields.description:
Our rest API advertises the ability to restrict changeset expansion using a [range specifier|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/REST/Atlassian+REST+API+Design+Guidelines+version+1#AtlassianRESTAPIDesignGuidelinesversion1-expansion].

The implementation of this is buggy and untested:

1. ranges of the form \[:N\] are not parsed correctly. 
2. there is no max return or truncation, so DoS is a problem.

tasks:

1. write unit tests for the parsing code, checking all permutations of range specifiers.
2. fix code to meet advertised range spec.

See {{RestChangesetService.java}}
fields.summary: [REST] Changeset expansion is buggy

But the text after the # is not put inside the <a> html tag.

fields.description:
We sometimes want to retain state while navigating from file to file via the directory tree.

# wayback specs, including the report parameters
# revisions after clicking on the source tab, so that choosing a new file will show a similar revision -- via an r=n parameter.

There are at least two bugs:

# When the report wayback spec is changed, the links in the file tree are not updated
# Each time you choose a new file when in the source view, another 'r' parameter is appended to your URLs, so you end up with ?r=123&r=335&...
fields.summary: Our handling of state via wayback and URL parameters while browsing the file tree is inconsistent and buggy

fields.description:
Hello, everyone.

NOTE: This can be seen with or without "Show all details" turned on.

The disclosure triangle is displayed when the commit message has three or more lines, like this:
{code}
FEI-1 Bla bla bla bla bla:

- Removed the following files: bla bla bla bla bla...
- Modified bla bla bla bla bla bla...
- Added bla bla bla bla bla....
{code}
The above is correct.
But the disclosure triangle is *NOT* displayed when the commit has *two* lines, like this:
{code}
FEI-1 Bla bla bla bla bla bla bla

Removed an incorrect bla bla bla bla bla bla...
{code}

In fact, the disclosure triangle should be displayed if the commit message has two lines or more, and should not be displayed if the commit message has only one line.

Please see the image attached.

Also, please let me know if you need further explanation.

Regards,
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Disclosure triangle on Revisions tab doesn't display when the commit message has two lines.

fields.description:
*consider for 2.4.x*

This is done via the singleton session, which is bad. This is particularly dangerous here because changesets are "suggested" based on presence of revisions already in the review, making branch or tag changesets particularly likely to be returned
fields.summary: Crucible "Add Content/Suggest Files" eagerly creates cruRevisions in showing suggestions

fields.description:
*consider for 2.4.x*

This will eagerly create all cruRevisions for the changeset via the Hibernate singleton session. BAD. Consider adding a {{Source.changesetExists(csid)}} method and documenting a contract of speedy return.
fields.summary: EditChangelogAction incorrectly uses Source.getChangeset(csid) to validate changeset

fields.description:
This means that a simple mouseover on a large ChangeSet can bring Crucible to its knees, because for an N-revision changeset, up to N cruRevisions and N storedPaths are added to CRU_DB through the singleton Hibernate session, blocking all review creation until completed. 

*Consider for a 2.4.x release*

Suggested solution:
 # remove the revision rollout on the tooltip - at most we want to know how many revisions? 
 # audit the subclasses of {{Source}} - if {{RepositorySource}} is the only {{changesetCapable}} subclass, consider avoiding source altogether and asking FishEye directly for this info (careful consideration of cs tooltip support in Crucible-only needed here)
 # add either a changeset revision counting method to {{Source}},documenting a contract of speedy return. Or add a {{getChangesetDescription()}} that returns a {{ChangeSetDescription}} object providing summary data?
 # Bonus refactor: rename {{Source}} to {{RevisionProvider}} or something. Don't forget subclasses.
fields.summary: ChangesetTooltipAction.findChangeSet() eagerly creates cruRevisions

fields.description:
Essentially you load a review and it constantly loads the details page in the review. Even, when navigating to another file, it will go back to continuously loading the details page.

I'm not sure how long this has been happening for (i.e i don't know if its an issue with 2.4 or 2.5mX)
The firefox version I have is 3.0.8, and yes I know it is old, but it could be indicative of bigger issues and probably shouldn't die quite this badly.
fields.summary: Review Constantly Refreshes when using FF3.0.x
Map .json files to javascript syntax hilighting

fields.description:
Scenario:

# I create a Review 'R'.
# Person A comes in and marks my review as completed; they have finished looking through it.
# I make changes to the code, commit it and add it to Review 'R' using the "Add to Review" button.
# An email is now sent out saying "REVIEW-R Person A has uncompleted this review." 

I believe that this message is misleading and it would be better if it said something like "REVIEW-R More content has been added to the review and as a result Person A has been moved back to a uncompleted status." Something like that sounds better to me and would be much appreciated.

A screenshot of an example email has been attached.
fields.summary: Better email message when "Add to Review" causes users to be incompleted.

fields.description:
1. Ensure that you're not logged in as a particular user.
2. Go to the {{server:8080/admin}} URL for the instance and use the Admin login.
3. Go to Repositories and try to edit a Repository's Application Links.

You get the attached permission error when trying to view the Application Links - "You are not logged in as a user that has administrator privileges".

The workaround appears to be to login as a user that has Administration access and then edit the configuration using that user.
fields.summary: Cannot edit Application Links when logged in to Crucible Administration console

fields.description: Branch selector doesn't check for the case where there is no default branch.  Tries to operate on the #select-branch-default link which doesn't exist.
fields.summary: Git - error when switch directories

fields.description:
Iterating over the file revisions in a manifest causes all its file revisions to be loaded into memory.  A vistor pattern would be more appropriate for most cases.

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-2043
fields.summary: Manifest implementation has large memory footprint

fields.description: When content of a {{.aspx}} file is added for code review via attachments, the code is not displayed in the source window. Only the "Download File" option is available.
fields.summary: Uploading .aspx file as an attachment to a review only allows "download file" option

fields.description:
I was performing my first crucible review of a changeset.

All but for of the files work fine, but clicking on one I get
{noformat}
An error occured attempting to display this file.
javax.el.ELException: java.lang.NullPointerException
{noformat}

I'm guessing it has something to do with the 'File Outdated' dropdown link?
fields.summary: Null pointer exception when reviewing an outdated file.
Ensure that REST tests work and pass in FE only and CRU only modes

fields.description:
Git indexing has issues with the following

# Repos with ambiguous main branch names
# Paths with spaces in them in certain situations
# Git commits which have not content (non-merge) empty commits.
fields.summary: Git Indexing Issues
unreadness of files doesnt get updated when you reload new defects in

fields.description:
In 2.4.2 you cannot change your user password, it continually says "Incorrect Password".  To reproduce:

# Create a new user and assign them a temporary password.
# Login with the new user.
# Go to User Profile -> Settings -> Change Password.
# Any attempt to change your password fails.  See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Cannot Change Password in User Settings

fields.description: When I apply a filter of "that is unreviewed" it correctly shows me the unreviewed files on the left file directory view. When I click on a file to review, it loads it then when I scroll down to read it, it immediately marks it reviewed and goes to the summary of the review. This is really annoying and I can't review the files that I want to.
fields.summary: "that is unreviewed" filter is broken

fields.description:
Use a custom search filter in Crucible with any of the statuses checked (Draft, Pending Approval, etc.), results in the above message along with the search results, in spite of the user having all required permissions.
Debugging logging:
{quote}
2010-11-19 08:47:21,303 DEBUG [btpool0-20] fisheye.perf UpfrontFilter-logRequest - end request GET /static/lakf91/2static/images/sprite_arrows.png sessionid=ocxwfgmtkeb617uq09r9ug92a
2010-11-19 08:47:23,878 DEBUG [btpool0-20] fisheye.perf UpfrontFilter-logRequest - start request GET /cru/reviews/?filter=custom&orRoles=false&creator=admin&reviewType=1&title=&reviewer=&project=&state=Draft&moderator=&complete=any&author= sessionid=ocxwfgmtkeb617uq09r9ug92a
2010-11-19 08:47:23,915 DEBUG [btpool0-20] fisheye.perf RepositoryHandle-acquire - acquire engine on git, count=1
2010-11-19 08:47:23,922 DEBUG [btpool0-20] fisheye.perf RepositoryHandle-release - release engine on git, count=0
2010-11-19 08:47:23,924 DEBUG [btpool0-20] fisheye.perf UpfrontFilter-logRequest - end request GET /cru/reviews/?filter=custom&orRoles=false&creator=admin&reviewType=1&title=&reviewer=&project=&state=Draft&moderator=&complete=any&author= sessionid=ocxwfgmtkeb617uq09r9ug92a
2010-11-19 08:47:23,939 DEBUG [btpool0-20] fisheye.perf UpfrontFilter-logRequest - start request GET /static/lakf91/2static/style/jquery/plugin/concat.style.e812e30257f2c2fa191af35f956b3018.cache.css sessionid=ocxwfgmtkeb617uq09r9ug92a
2010-11-19 08:47:23,940 DEBUG [btpool0-20] fisheye.perf UpfrontFilter-logRequest - end request GET /static/lakf91/2static/style/jquery/plugin/concat.style.e812e30257f2c2fa191af35f956b3018.cache.css sessionid=ocxwfgmtkeb617uq09r9ug92a
{quote}
Rebuilt Crucible index via the UI as well as deleting from the filesystem but the error persists.

Unchecking all the boxes, gets rid of the message.
fields.summary: "You do not have permission to see all the search results." for custom search filter in Crucible

fields.description:
Dragging the slider causes text to be selected. This problem does not occur on FishEye pages

!http://img.skitch.com/20101118-1ttjcurfpk5hsb5baaycb83xw3.jpg!
fields.summary: Review splitter dragging highlights text
Only render visible results to improve performance
Fix hit highlighting bug causing dropped results
Improve existing quicksearch implementation

fields.description:
The "latest comment" is double-escaped on the review front page:

!crucible double escape.png!
fields.summary: Double-escaping issue in latest comment

fields.description:
Admin should page the group list, and use auto-complete or similar instead of listing all group names in a dropdown.


The two places in admin where groups affect performance most is on the Repositories > (click a repo) > Permissions tab and the Groups page itself.


https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-4551
fields.summary: Improve fe/cru admin for large numbers of groups

fields.description:
This is a feature request in reference to Crucible Support ticket: CRC-2083

We have a single CVS repository with multiple projects belonging to it as folders:

CVSREPO:
   Project 1
   Project 2
   Project 3

When we map a project to a CVSREPO folder we would like the activity screen of fisheye to also be restricted to that folder.  Currently if you go to the project page activity tab you will see activity for the ENTIRE repository not just the mapped folder.
fields.summary: Ability to map projects to SCM directories

fields.description: Currently, when creating a review, the file/changeset can only be added one by one. It would be good if we could add the entire branch/folder into the review.
fields.summary: Allow to add the entire branch to be reviewed

fields.description: A customer would like to suggest a new state/color for files that have been added in the first included revision and then subsequently changed. This would make it obvious that the whole file needs to be looked at. I would also suggest to default the display to the latest revision (in the review) instead of the changes after adding.
fields.summary: Added and Changed files do not always display as Added
pre loading of files doesnt work when pressing 'y' to go through a review

fields.description: !http://content.screencast.com/users/AdamAtlassian/folders/Jing/media/77cea0ef-bf20-4f40-a4c5-dd37692554e4/2010-11-17_1549.png!
fields.summary: IE7 - Tools menu goes under the aui-toolbar in Crucible
